description: The U.S. Postal Service's loss widened in fiscal 2024, although revenue rose slightly after two stamp hikes this year.
title: After two stamp hikes, the USPS lost nearly $10 billion in 2024

description: President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday named Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as his pick to lead the Department of Health and Human Services. If confirmed, Kennedy would be in charge of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Institutes of Health, Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services and the Food and Drug Administration. CBS News political reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more.
title: Trump names RFK Jr. as his pick for secretary of health and human services

description: Kennedy has a long record of criticizing vaccines, including spreading misleading claims about their safety.
title: Trump will nominate RFK Jr. for HHS secretary

description: Satirical publication The Onion has purchased Infowars, Alex Jones' embattled brand. the Connecticut families of eight victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting and one first responder backed the purchase. Benjamin Mullin, a media reporter for The New York Times, joins CBS News with more.
title: Behind the surprising Infowars purchase by The Onion

description: A fire is burning along the New Jersey-New York border as an emergency drought warning emerges. CBS News' Tom Hanson has the latest.
title: Emergency drought warning in New Jersey as fire rages

description: Tropical Storm Sara is sitting off the shore of Honduras and Mexico and could travel to the Gulf of Mexico and strengthen over warmer waters. CBS News Bay Area meteorologist Jessica Burch has the latest forecast.
title: Tropical Storm Sara near Mexico, could strengthen and slam U.S.

description: President Biden is at the APEC summit in Lima, Peru, where he will meet with China's Xi Jinping. CBS News' Natalie Brand has the latest on the significance of the meeting and more details on President-elect Donald Trump's chat with Mr. Biden.
title: Behind Biden's meetings with China's Xi, Trump

description: A recess appointment would allow Trump to install some officials and sidestep lengthy hearings and a floor vote.
title: What to know about recess appointments as Gaetz faces Senate headwinds

description: Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency said it is already recruiting people to work on the new initiative to cut federal spending.
title: Elon Musk's DOGE is hiring. Here's the kind of person he's looking for.

description: Trump stuns Congress by choosing Matt Gaetz for attorney general; The Onion buys Alex Jones' Infowars.
title: Nov 14: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET

description: Among the 757 reports received, 4% had unusual descriptions, like "green fireball" or "a jelly fish with [multicolored] flashing lights."
title: Annual UFO report finds 21 cases of more than 700 received need more analysis

description: Officials provided an update after a building collapse trapped at least one person under rubble in Louisville, Kentucky. Here's the latest confirmed information.
title: Person trapped beneath building collapse rubble, Kentucky officials say

description: Former Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz will have to be confirmed by the Senate before he becomes President-elect Donald Trump's attorney general. Some members of Congress are already having strong reactions to Trump's pick. CBS News' Olivia Rinaldi reports. Also, Zeke Miller,  chief White House correspondent for the Associated Press, has more on the state of the House Ethics probe into Gaetz.
title: Can Gaetz get Senate confirmation to be Trump's attorney general?

description: Gold's price is dipping. Here's how savvy investors can use these moves to capitalize on that trend.
title: 3 smart gold moves to make while the price is dropping

description: Four women who sued over Idaho's strict abortion ban are in court to make their case for more clarification, and the expansion of some exceptions under the new law. CBS News' Nicole Valdes has more.
title: Latest news on Idaho's strict abortion ban

description: With inflation rising again, homeowners considering using their home equity should review both options carefully.
title: Is a HELOC or home equity loan better with inflation rising?

description: There are some major pros and cons to accessing your home equity before 2025. Here's what to consider right now.
title: Considering using your home equity now? Pros and cons of acting before 2025

description: Tensions are high in Paris as some pro-Palestinian protests against Israel's war in Gaza are leading to violence ahead of a soccer match between Israel and France. CBS News' Chris Livesay reports on the security concerns and the antisemitism being seen in Europe.
title: What to know about Paris tensions ahead of Israel-France soccer match

description: New economic data is trickling in and the latest producer price index numbers could signal a potential trend about the state of inflation in the U.S. CBS MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady has more.
title: How new producer price data signals potential costs for Americans

description: President Biden headed to Peru Thursday for the APEC summit where he is meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping. This comes after his meeting with President-elect Donald Trump at the White House. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes reports.
title: What's next for Biden after Trump transition meeting?

description: Inflation grew again in October, leading some to wonder about the merits of borrowing from their home equity now.
title: Should you open a home equity loan with inflation rising again?

description: Illinois Sen. Dick Durbin, the Senate's majority whip, is calling for the preservation of the report and any documentation pertaining to the House Ethics Committee inquiry into Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane has more.
title: Durbin on Gaetz ethics report as Congress reacts to Trump's attorney general pick

description: Many of President-elect Donald Trump's team picks for his second term in the White House will have to go through the Senate confirmation process. Also, an expected House ethics inquiry into Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz, Trump's pick for attorney general, could affect how Congress acts during his confirmation process. CBS News' Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.
title: What's next for Congress after Trump's Gaetz nomination, other team picks?

description: Finding the right solution to your high-rate credit card debt can be tough if your credit is less than ideal.
title: Does debt consolidation or debt forgiveness make more sense with bad credit?

description: The DOJ launched a civil rights investigation into conditions at the Fulton County Jail after several inmates had died in a matter of weeks. One inmate, according to his family, was "eaten alive" by bed bugs.
title: DOJ report says Georgia jail left inmates vulnerable to dangerous conditions

description: Billy Bob Thornton stars in "Landman," a series crafted specifically for him by Taylor Sheridan.
title: Billy Bob Thornton takes on oil industry in new series, "Landman"

description: Tropical Storm Sara developed in the Caribbean on Thursday, threatening parts of Central America with life-threatening and potentially catastrophic rain.
title: Tropical Storm Sara forms in the Caribbean

description: In the first volume of the singer-actress' memoirs, Cher recounts attending, at age 11, an event that would change the direction of her life: an Elvis Presley concert.
title: Book excerpt: "Cher: The Memoir – Part One"

description: U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission issues urgent safety alert after ninth recall of adult bed rails in three years.
title: Feds warn against bed rails, citing 18 deaths since 2021

description: Tom Harries, CEO and founder of Earth Funeral, explains the process of being turned into soil in about 30 days — and how your loved ones can then decide what to do with it.
title: How human composting offers alternatives to burial, cremation

description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul announced Thursday that congestion pricing will come to New York City in January, charging most drivers $9 to enter Manhattan's Congestion Relief zone below 60th street.
title: New York City to start congestion pricing in January at $9, Gov. Kathy Hochul announces

description: Air pollution choking New Delhi has ground outdoor work to a halt and disrupted air travel in the Indian capital.
title: Delhi air pollution sparks emergency measures as smog shrouds city

description: New research shows that retirees' credit card debt is growing. Here's how you can tackle yours now.
title: What are the best ways to get rid of credit card debt in retirement?

description: The Russian planes were "not adhering to international norms" when Italian and Norwegian NATO jets were mobilized.
title: NATO jets scrambled after Russian aircraft spotted

description: Here's how to get a free holiday-themed reusable red cup and what else there is to know about the event.
title: It's Starbucks Red Cup Day. Here's what to know about the event.

description: President Biden is heading to South America Thursday with his first stop coming at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit where he'll meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden to meet with China's Xi Jinping at APEC summit

description: President-elect Donald Trump's choice for attorney general, Matt Gaetz, is facing a tough Senate confirmation process for the job. CBS News political director Fin Gómez reports on some of the speculation about why Trump made such a controversial pick.
title: Trump picking Gaetz for AG may be loyalty test for senators

description: Ben & Jerry's independent board accuses Unilever of preventing the ice cream brand from advocating for Palestinian rights.
title: Ben & Jerry's sues Unilever, saying parent company censored it over Gaza

description: India's Supreme Court has warned state authorities that bulldozing illegally constructed homes in an "arbitrary pick and choose" way is an abuse of their powers.
title: India court warns against "bulldozer justice" allegedly targeting Muslims

description: A day after the CPI report revealed a rise in inflation for October, the Producer Price Index is showing a similar increase for wholesale goods. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady has a look at the numbers.
title: Wholesale prices up 0.2% in October

description: South Africa's government says it will let thousands of illegal miners starve until they accept their fate and emerge from an abandoned shaft to face arrest.
title: South Africa is trying to starve 4,000 miners out of an illegal mine

description: After Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Alexei Zimin posted anti-war messages and stopped his cooking show on a pro-Kremlin television station.
title: Famed Russian chef and Putin critic found dead in Belgrade

description: Jaleel White joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to discuss his new book "Growing Up Urkel," and talks about life after his role as the beloved character Steve Urkel.
title: Jaleel White on his new book, "Growing Up Urkel" and life after "Family Matters"

description: Satirical news outlet the Onion has purchased Alex Jones' Infowars site out of bankruptcy. The sale comes after the families of Sandy Hook shooting victims won a $1.5 billion libel suit against Jones for spreading false information and conspiracy theories about the shooting. CBS News correspondent Lilia Luciano has more.
title: The Onion buys Infowars out of bankruptcy in move backed by Sandy Hook families

description: Most people choose burial or cremation, but human composting is becoming a popular alternative. Tom Harries, CEO of Earth Funeral, explains how it works and why it's different.
title: How human composting is offering a new alternative to burial and cremation

description: In today's "Mornings Memory," we look back to 2002 when Perdue Farms chairman Jim Perdue stepped out of his office to work alongside his employees.
title: "Mornings Memory": Perdue Farms chairman Jim Perdue trades the boardroom for the "trenches"

description: With just six weeks left in 2024, Jill Schlesinger shares practical tips to help you save or even earn extra cash by the new year.
title: Expert on tips to boost your finances before the new year

description: Social psychologist Jonathan Haidt, author of "The Anxious Generation," joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to explain how modern technology and life online are contributing to a "great re-wiring" in society and what it means for the future.
title: Social psychologist Jonathan Haidt on how technology is reshaping society

description: Seniors contemplating a reverse mortgage should familiarize themselves with these five facts before getting started.
title: 5 important reverse mortgage facts seniors should know

description: Lawmakers had a range of responses to President-elect Donald Trump's announcement that he'll nominate Matt Gaetz for attorney general. CBS News political reporter Jake Rosen has more.
title: Lawmakers react to Trump nominating Gaetz for attorney general

description: Protesters marched Wednesday night in France against the war in Gaza amid Thursday's soccer match between the French national team and Israel. While the march was peaceful, tensions are high on the heels of violence last week outside of a match in Amsterdam.
title: Protests in France over Gaza war amid soccer match with Israel

description: Meteorologist Stephanie Abrams with The Weather Channel gives an update on Tropical Depression 19 in the Caribbean, which could develop into a late-season storm that impacts Florida.
title: What to know about a tropical depression that could develop into a late-season storm

description: The Jennings Creek Fire in New Jersey has burned nearly 4,300 acres. It's about half contained as firefighters have performed controlled burns, getting rid of dry vegetation that could otherwise fuel the blaze. Meanwhile, a record dry spell in the Northeast is fueling wildfires in more places. On Wednesday, a brush fire broke out on the northern tip of Manhattan in a wooded park.
title: Half of New Jersey wildfire contained as other fires break out

description: CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa joins "CBS Mornings" to break down President-elect Donald Trump's latest choices for his Cabinet, including the controversial pick of Matt Gaetz.
title: Analysis of President-elect Trump Cabinet picks Matt Gaetz, Tulsi Gabbard

description: CBS News projects that Republicans will maintain a majority in the House of Representatives, claiming at least 218 seats, while some races remain undecided over a week after Election Day. Starting in January, the GOP will control the House, Senate and White House.
title: CBS News projects Republicans win the House after already claiming Senate, White House

description: President-elect Donald Trump said Rep. Matt Gaetz is his pick to be nominated for attorney general. The announcement comes just two days before the House ethics committee was set to vote on releasing what sources say is a highly damaging report about an investigation into Gaetz over claims he partied with teenage girls. Gaetz, who has denied all wrongdoing, resigned from his seat in the House of Representatives after Trump's announcement, House Speaker Mike Johnson said.
title: President-elect Trump picks Matt Gaetz for attorney general amid investigation

description: As the weather cools down, dating heats up — but here's why a "slowmance" might be worth a try this cuffing season.
title: Why a "slowmance" may be a great approach this cuffing season

description: Satirical publication The Onion, with the support of Sandy Hook families, purchased the bankrupt site of conspiracy theorist Alex Jones.
title: The Onion buys Alex Jones' Infowars at bankruptcy auction

description: Oscar-winning actor Billy Bob Thornton joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss his new role in "Landman," the latest Paramount Plus series from Yellowstone creator Taylor Sheridan. Thornton stars as Tommy Norris, a man tasked with managing land and people in the oil-rich landscapes of West Texas.
title: Billy Bob Thornton on starring in new drama, "Landman" from "Yellowstone" creator

description: For some investors, it may still be smart to buy gold right now, even with the price still high. Here's why.
title: With gold's price high should beginners still invest? Experts weigh in

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, we show you items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Violinist Ezinma is bringing classical and contemporary music together. Her sound is capturing the attention of stars like Beyoncé and reimagining how audiences experience the violin.
title: Violinist Ezinma on blending classical and contemporary sounds

description: Some 4,000 security forces were deployed to keep the peace in Paris as Israel's national soccer team faces France a week after antisemitic attacks in Amsterdam.
title: Paris on alert as Israeli soccer team to play after violence in Amsterdam

description: As inflation nears the government's two percent target, food prices continue to rise while energy costs decline. Jill Schlesinger explains what these changes mean for consumers.
title: U.S. inflation shows signs of improvement as prices stabilize since 2022

description: NFL Week 11 will feature huge matchups, including an AFC divisional round rematch between the undefeated Kansas City Chiefs and the Buffalo Bills. The Pittsburgh Steelers will host the Baltimore Ravens in a crucial division game. Lead NFL reporter for CBS Sports, Tracy Wolfson, gives a preview.
title: AFC heavyweights, division rivals headline major matchups in NFL this weekend

description: Thousands of police have been deployed and security measures have been ratcheted up in Paris ahead of an international soccer match between France and Israel Thursday. The match comes a week after Israeli fans were targeted after a club match in Amsterdam in what officials say were antisemitic attacks. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay has more.
title: Heightened security ahead of soccer match between Israel and France

description: President-elect Donald Trump raised eyebrows Wednesday when he announced he'll nominate Matt Gaetz to be his attorney general. CBS News political reporter Jake Rosen has more on if Gaetz will actually take that position.
title: How likely is it that Trump Cabinet picks like Matt Gaetz will be confirmed?

description: A new report shows global diabetes rates have doubled, rising from 7% in 1990 to 14% in 2022, with the largest increase seen in low and middle-income countries. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Celine Gounder joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the health risks tied to this surge.
title: New report reveals global diabetes rates have doubled since 1990

description: The head of British Vogue says she's concerned that designers are returning to ultra-thin fashion models. She believes it's happening, in part, because of weight loss drugs. A recent report found that less than 1% of this year's models were plus-sized.
title: Concern in fashion industry over model sizes creating unrealistic standards

description: On Wednesday, a judge allowed a Federal Trade Commission lawsuit to move forward that accuses Meta of creating an illegal monopoly with Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady explains.
title: Facebook's parent company, Meta, facing courtroom battle

description: Controversial congressman Matt Gaetz has been selected by President-elect Donald Trump to be attorney general. Meanwhile, wildfires continue to burn in the Northeast. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: President-elect Donald Trump taps Matt Gaetz for attorney general

description: Four people have been arrested for allegedly carrying out a bizarre insurance fraud scheme where they staged bear attacks inside cars. Authorities say the suspects submitted videos for insurance claims on what they said were bear attacks, but investigators say the bear was actually a person in a bear suit.
title: 4 arrested for faking bear attacks for insurance payouts

description: Authorities suspect they've found the remains of 10 to 20 human skulls on a property in southeastern New Mexico.
title: Skulls linked to missing woman, other possible victims found in New Mexico

description: There is uncertainty about what will happen to the world's battle against climate change as President-elect Trump says he'll again withdraw the U.S. from the Paris Climate Agreement. Fred Krupp, president of the Environmental Defense Fund, joined CBS News to discuss climate change.
title: What Trump's second term could mean for U.S. efforts to tackle climate change

description: Lindsey Vonn says she is coming out of retirement to rejoin the U.S. Ski Team in an attempt to race again at age 40.
title: Olympic gold medalist Lindsey Vonn, 40, coming out of retirement

description: Drought conditions in the New York area are still fueling the Jennings Creek Fire along the New York-New Jersey state line. CBS News correspondent Tom Hanson has the latest from Hewitt, New Jersey.
title: Deadly New York-New Jersey wildfire about 50% contained

description: All new: A toxic couple orchestrates an elaborate plan to kill a mother. "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Nov. 16 at 10/9c on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: The Plot to Eliminate Alyssa Burkett

description: President-elect Donald Trump has chosen a number of nominees to fill out his cabinet, but there's still a Senate confirmation process before those nominees are able to take their posts. Stephen Neukam, co-author of Axios Hill Leaders, joined CBS News to break down what those processes entail.
title: What goes into the Senate confirmation process for Trump's cabinet picks

description: The necklace containing around 300 carats of diamonds was bought by an unidentified woman who put in her bid over the phone, Sotheby's said.
title: Mysterious diamond necklace linked to queen's demise sells for $4.8 million

description: Scientists say they've discovered a "mega coral" three times bigger than the previous record holder - so huge they initially thought it was a shipwreck.
title: Scientists say biggest coral in the world discovered in the Pacific

description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has accused Donald Trump of repeatedly criticizing him because of his "ethnicity" and Muslim faith, comments likely to renew his long-running feud with Trump.
title: London mayor says Trump's attacks on him are due to his ethnicity and religion

description: An LSU student has been arrested after allegedly making an online threat to kill Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry, who advocated for bringing a live tiger onto the field as part of a recent college football game.
title: LSU student arrested for allegedly threatening governor over tiger at game

description: President-elect Trump has proposed wide-ranging tariffs, which he claims he can unilaterally impose. The reality is more complicated, according to experts.
title: Can Trump impose tariffs without Congress? It's complicated, experts say.

description: Trump selects Gaetz, Gabbard to join his Cabinet; Vietnam War-era “Dustoff” crews honored with Congressional Gold Medal
title: 11/13: CBS Evening News

description: Billionaires Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy will head an effort, dubbed DOGE, to reduce wasteful federal spending. Here's what it's about.
title: What to know about Trump's DOGE, led by Musk and Ramaswamy
